page.title: 03KIRBY HILL
page.content: Manor House was once a private school it is now a private house, there used to be a blacksmiths shop and a small general shop in the village, these are also now private houses. John Daykin, who died in about 1558, was the last catholic priest in the parish, he founded a trust to pay for the day school and old peoples accomodation. Since the school closed money from the trust is used to provide grants to any child in the parish going on to further education. A house consisting of six self contained flats was built to replace the old peoples accomodation, these flats are let out rent and rate free to any elderly people who qualify. There is one public house in the village.
